Dear ___,

We are writing to provide you with a summary of your hospitalization from March 1, 2024, to March 6, 2024, for your acute medical event.  

Upon admission, you presented with severe chest pain radiating to your left arm and shortness of breath. An electrocardiogram (ECG) confirmed the presence of an ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), specifically identified as an acute transmural myocardial infarction of the anterior wall. Immediate medical intervention was undertaken, including Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) with stent placement, which you tolerated well.

During your hospitalization, careful monitoring was conducted, and you showed significant improvement. Initial lab tests revealed elevated troponin levels, peaking 12 hours post-admission, but these levels began to decrease progressively from the second day of your stay. Your complete blood count was within normal limits, though your lipid profile indicated elevated LDL cholesterol levels. Continuous infusion of IV Heparin was administered along with a medication regimen that included Aspirin, Clopidogrel, and Metoprolol to aid in your recovery. Additional medications introduced during your stay included Lisinopril and a statin, both of which will be continued post-discharge.

Throughout your hospital course, your vital signs remained stable, and you reported an improvement in symptoms. By the morning of March 3, it was noted that you felt significantly better, and there was a focus on planning your rehabilitation and discharge. By March 5, all necessary discharge instructions were conveyed, and you were provided with prescriptions for your continued medication at home. We also discussed lifestyle modifications important for your recovery and future health. A heart-healthy diet and regular, moderate-intensity exercise have been suggested. Smoking cessation support, as well as stress management strategies, were recommended to support your holistic recovery.

Follow-up care has been arranged, and you are scheduled to visit the cardiology outpatient clinic on March 20, 2024, to ensure your recovery progresses well and to manage your medications appropriately.

Please feel free to reach out to our department or your cardiologist if you have any questions or concerns before your follow-up appointment. Our team is committed to supporting you on your path to recovery.

Wishing you a swift recovery.

Best regards,
